issue.title: LND can't connect with ZMQ
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

Bitcoin core v29.0 is running all good, but LND can't connect to the ZMQ endpoints anymore, issue created in LND here:
https://github.com/lightningnetwork/lnd/issues/9706

### Expected behaviour

LND should connect correctly to the ZMQ endpoints from bitcoin core v29.0, like they do with v28.1

### Steps to reproduce

Run LND v0.19.0rc2 together with Bitcoin core v29.0

### Relevant log output

```
Apr 12 23:02:53 lnd-mainnet lnd[3373367]: 2025-04-12 23:02:53.276 [INF] RPCC: Established connection to RPC server 192.168.178.109:8332
Apr 12 23:02:53 lnd-mainnet lnd[3373367]: 2025-04-12 23:02:53.276 [INF] RPCC: Established connection to RPC server 192.168.178.109:8332
Apr 12 23:02:53 lnd-mainnet lnd[3373367]: 2025-04-12 23:02:53.278 [ERR] LTND: unable to create partial chain control: unable to subscribe for zmq block events: dial tcp 192.168.178.109:28332: connect: connection refused
Apr 12 23:02:53 lnd-mainnet lnd[3373367]: 2025-04-12 23:02:53.278 [ERR] LTND: Shutting down due to error in main method rev=0053fd err="unable to create partial chain control: unable to subscribe for zmq block events: dial tcp 192.168.178.109:28332: connect: connection refused"
```

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

v29.0

### Operating system and version

Debian 11

### Machine specifications

_No response_

events.body: whats your bitcoin.conf and lnd.conf? does it work if you downgrade to bitcoin 28 or lnd 18?

It works when I downgrade bitcoin core to 28.1, unfortunately LND 0.19 has db migrations and cannot downgrade to 0.18.x, so cannot test that.
 
I guess this is all that's related:
bitcoin core
```
zmqpubrawblock=tcp://0.0.0.0:28332
zmqpubrawtx=tcp://0.0.0.0:28333
```
lnd:
```
bitcoind.zmqpubrawblock=tcp://192.168.178.109:28332
bitcoind.zmqpubrawtx=tcp://192.168.178.109:28333
```

> Compiled from source

just to make sure, did you compile bitcoin core with `-DWITH_ZMQ=ON` ([doc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/zmq.md))?
It works now, when compiling with `-DWITH_ZMQ=ON`. This wasn't needed with the previous build system, was it?

I read the draft release notes for v29.0 [here](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/29.0-Release-Notes-draft). But did not read anything about this change. Maybe worth adding that in?

There is a link to new build system options:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/Autotools-to-CMake-Options-Mapping

I think the point is that pretty much everything optional is now opt in, when, previously it would be compiled in based on a dependency being available. The release notes don't seem to mention this at all.
Also, zmq-related startup options such as `zmqpubhashblock` could throw an init error (or at least a warning) if zmq wasn't compiled in, instead of silently being ignored.

> init error


That's a good point actually, I'm pretty sure rpc `getzmqnotifications` is "unknown command" when not compiled
Apparently there is a historical reason to quietly ignore configurations that are known but not supported by the build: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13441

> It works now, when compiling with -DWITH_ZMQ=ON. This wasn't needed with the previous build system, was it?

Indeed, it's confusing that configure defaults changed. I added a couple sentences to the website release notes: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoincore.org/pull/1119/ Lmk how that looks? Otherwise I think this issue can be marked resolved.

> I added a couple sentences to the website release notes

Nice! This should already help!
I will make a PR to make it more prominent in the build docs as well.
